name: Challenge: A good build for throwing weapons
author: grom56

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I have not seen many builds posted that have focus in Darts or Throwing axes (or Shurikens).
Do you have a link to a good build or perhaps a build lurking somewhere on your hard drive that you want to share?

What challenges me with Darts and Throwing axes is that the character benefits from Strength because of the mighty property, and needs Strength because of the encumbrance you get from multiple stacks of weapons. So Strength is good for playability and damage, but one needs Dexterity (or Wisdom) for a sufficiently high AB.

Throwing weapons are a sub-group of ranged weapons and use Dexterity to determine their AB. They can also use Wisdom with the Zen archery feat. Point blank shot and Rapid shot work with throwing weapons.
Darts and Throwing axes are automatically Mighty up to the character's Strength modifier, Shurikens are not.
Throwing weapons can be used with a shield. They can not be dual wielded.

Dart:
Weight (lb): 0.1
Damage: 1d4 + Strength modifier /x2
Damage type: Piercing
Size: Tiny
Proficiency: Druid, Rogue, Simple

Throwing axe:
Weight (lb): 1
Damage: 1d6 + Strength modifier /x2
Damage type: Slashing
Size: Small
Proficiency: Martial

Shuriken:
Weight (lb): 0
Damage: 1d3 /x2
Damage type: Piercing
Size: Tiny
Proficiency: Exotic, Monk

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:Check this out Mick, i think DD here might have done a good work.

=> http://worldofgreyhawk.fr.yuku.com/topi ... -Dream-Elf
DD claims that: " Damage per hit averages about 45 (90 w/critical hit)"
That does not make sense even if you cap every stat with items and always land sneak attacks.
The build does 11 +16 base damage. Divine might let you add +5. If you can land sneak attacks, you can add 2-12 SA damage.
Max damage with full Paladin buffs and Divine Might is 14-19 (slashing) + 9 (divine) + 5 (magical) = 28-33. You can add 2-12 whenever you can land SA. It is not bad, even if it does not hold what it promises.

AB unbuffed is 40.
Max AB with paladin buffs (Bless, Aid, Prayer, Divine Favour) is: 48 (not 60)
Capped AB is 66.
Not stellar, but still quite OK

DD writes: "Appreciation goes out to the changes to the weapon buffs that allow keen, gmw, and flame weapon to be cast on thrown weapons--it really makes this build more than viable."
If that is the case on WoG where this is posted, then some of the figures make more sense.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Yes Mick, i believe he meant that damage when he is fully buffed and with WoG changes too. DD is one of the builders that takes into account the modifications of each PW he plays and so it makes sense to figure those in his calculations, at least for there. Now of course if his layout were more comprehensible we could perhaps understand better from where those figures come but he always posts in this format.

About his AB for example which is the easy one to figure out, i think he meant that 60 AB with 40 (base) + 6(epic throwing axes?) +6 (max DEX) +8 (Paladin buffs), which is a super ideal set-up but it may come true.

Now Damage for example could include, flame weapon (12 Avg. Dmg & don't get multiplied on crit. hit) +5 (Div. Favour) +1 (Prayer) +10 (max STR) +6 (EWS) +6 (Epic throwing axes?) +7 (Avg. sneak attack) +11 (max CHA & Div. might) +3 (Avg. holy sword) and so on...


I hope i helped a little,

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:I hope i helped a little
You definitely did!
The build is not bad. It illustrates that creativity is necessary when it's not enough to pump a single stat.
Paladin is definitely one way to improve both AB and damage. Fighter gives EWS. Cleric must have something to offer too, and maybe even Bard. RDD and builds with massive SA damage also look promising. Halflings have a bonus to AB from their dexterity bonus and small stature, and get the Good aim feat that works with hurled weapons. But they suffer a strength penalty.
Here is much to explore, and difficult to get it right since the stat spread seems to gimp the builds!
If only Enchant Arrow worked with other ranged weapons than bows. *Sighs*

Edit: And Ranger - of course is another source of damage vs FE's

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Theophilus_Fist wrote: the real concern (for me) is lugging around enough throwing axes - at one pound each. When I play ranged, I usually keep a minimum of 500 missiles on me. At lower levels, 500 pounds of axes (plus a 45 pound Tower shield) is a chore.
You need Bags of holding, and they are often not available at low levels. Even if you have them, your character must have enough strength for the armor & shield and one full stack of 50 axes equipped, plus all the junk that you use to fill your inventory with.
One workaround is to start with darts at low levels. Their weight is 10% compared with throwing axes. You can continue with darts, or you can switch to axes when you have Bags, buffs and items with a strength bonus.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Sweet!
I like this one much better.
Barbarian gives full warrior BAB, uncanny dodge and more HP and skill points than Fighter. But I'd like to see more feats, especially in epic levels. EWS is also desirable in a "semi-strength" dex build. The question is if one can live without uncanny dodge.
Halfling is great for AB, but gives an XP penalty.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I like this one too!

In my opinion Mick, loosing 15 AC (40 DEX buffed) is not an option so, UD it is. Moreover the second build has greater potential for optimization as well, You can start with two less STR and put those precious stat points in INT and get +86 skill points, then replace Toughness perhaps with Terrifying Rage and thus be immune to Mobbing, which is great for a thrower! Most likely i would also abandoned Dev. Critical and take some must have feats the OP didn't take and more Gr. Stat points as well. I am very sure that with little optimization of the originall you can come up with a 43 AB thrower that has full plate armour and Terrifying Rage with ESF in it, whilst he still has big STR (24-26).

To summarize, UD + TER. RAGE + DRAGON > EWS +Temporal Paladin Buffs. But yeah nothing is really great, i mean when comparing them to a Bowman at least, but such is the nature of the thrower. That they came close though, it is really great, certainly viable options for playing both of them.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
- Hp's are very good for an archer (thrower), saves are good likewise against spells and he has UMD to cover most of the rest.
- AC is 38 (44) with just plain clothes & shield, nuff said & UD to protect them.
- AB is 48 within PB range which is fantastic for such a build!
- He can fight with finesse and a not too shabby 44 AB, that is what good fighters have as primary AB.
- He has a very high DC with his Terrifying Rage that further will prevent him from get mobbed and will alone finish off entire encounters.
- He has Blind fight, no feat starvation unlike many other archer builds.
- Unlike most archers, he isn't hold back from the mighty property bows have in PW's, thus in game his Dmg will very likely be always 6 points higher.
- He has all those nifty RDD immunities.
- In WoG for example to compare with DD's thrower he can make (with UMD) those stacks of axes, +5 Keen flaming holy plus your 12 STR modifier plus the elemental Dmg from axes, doesn't look so bad now eh?

..............................................

Alright, with this one i stopped joking and started to take throwers seriously, get this posted in the forty's section asap.

I will say it again,

48 AB with a thrower, plus 44 AB melee!

* I would probably move some points from Listen or Discipline (cause AC too damn high, for Discipline to matter, except from rare disarms) to Spellcraft to get the full +9 bonus (42+3), Make UMD 30 OR 35 too.

.............................................

That's a very cool build Mick.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I was sure that you will do this, sooner or later... but where is that Divine Dmg?

1) Definitely start with 16 DEX & 14 CHA, and take Divine might in place of Expertise, this Hin will have Uncanny dodge and high DEX (plus full tumble), so his AC will be very good anyway.

2) Move Blind fighting earlier on the line - maybe in place of improved critical:dart.

3) Exchange Taunt with Discipline for Disarms, you will be most likely immune via UMD to Knockdown but those disarms especially when you melee can hurt. At least those Ranks will prevent the lucky shots from Mobs.

OR Exchange Taunt for Spellcraft cc Ranks. You can definitely use +4 to all saves Vs spells, besides i can't see you going up & close with him for Taunting then step-back and start throwing darts.

4) Consider finish your stats at DEX (30) & CHA (16), 45 AB is very good for a Darthrower and you ill make good use of that buffed (28) CHA both for your saves and for Divine might.

5) Those 14D6 Sneaks will definitely hurt big time your foes


Another very good build Mick, you really have a Knack for Archers of any type!

Some good suggestions you have there Valerfor.
I'm with grizzled_dwarflord on this one
"It is my opinion that Blackguards just can't compete with Paladins in that (charisma) category.// I just think of Blackguards as wonderfully delicious fighters complete with sneak attacks, great summon spells, better saves, Taunt, Bulls Strengths and the list goes on and on."
With all that SA damage, I don't need to pump charisma for DM.
A tweak would be, just like you suggest to exchange Expertise for DM. The way the build is, that would give +6 divine damage for 6 rounds with capped charisma from items and Eagle's. Your suggestion would give +8 divine damage for 8 rounds at the cost of 1AB, 1 AC and the possibility to have +5 AC with a respectable AB +42/43. You can also keep adding +1 to divine damage and duration at the cost of 1AB and AC.
I still feel it is hard to give up the +47/48 signature AB .
I guess I forgot to mention the PET
